content:
It's always a good idea to keep your bike in good working condition, especially if you're planning to transport it on a carrier.

I'd recommend getting your bike's gears checked out before getting the bike carrier, especially since you mentioned you had a minor issue during your last bike trip. Here's why:

1. **Safety first**: If your gears are not functioning properly, it could affect your bike's performance and safety on the road. You wouldn't want to risk any accidents or mechanical failures while transporting your bike.
2. **Prevent further damage**: If there's an underlying issue with your gears, transporting your bike could exacerbate the problem, leading to more costly repairs down the line. It's better to address the issue now and avoid any potential damage.
3. **Ensure a smooth ride**: A well-maintained bike will provide a more enjoyable and comfortable ride. By getting your gears checked, you'll be able to tackle your next bike trip with confidence.

Consider visiting a local bike shop or a trusted mechanic to inspect and adjust your bike's gears. They can diagnose any issues and perform the necessary repairs or adjustments to get your bike running smoothly.

Remember, it's always better to be proactive about bike maintenance to ensure your safety and enjoyment on the road!
